identity.Description: Azure Active Directory identity configuration for a resource.

sku.Description: Billing information related properties of a server.

properties.Description: The properties used to create a new server.

location.Description: The location the resource resides in.

tags.Description: Application-specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

principalId.Description: The Azure Active Directory principal id.

type.Description: The identity type. Set this to 'SystemAssigned' in order to automatically create and assign an Azure Active Directory principal for the resource. Possible values include: 'SystemAssigned'

tenantId.Description: The Azure Active Directory tenant id.

name.Description: The name of the sku, typically, tier + family + cores, e.g. B_Gen4_1, GP_Gen5_8.

tier.Description: The tier of the particular SKU, e.g. Basic. Possible values include: 'Basic', 'GeneralPurpose', 'MemoryOptimized'

capacity.Description: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

size.Description: The size code, to be interpreted by resource as appropriate.

sslEnforcement.Description: Enable ssl enforcement or not when connect to server. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

minimalTlsVersion.Description: Enforce a minimal Tls version for the server. Possible values include: 'TLS1_0', 'TLS1_1', 'TLS1_2', 'TLSEnforcementDisabled'

infrastructureEncryption.Description: Status showing whether the server enabled infrastructure encryption. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Whether or not public network access is allowed for this server. Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

storageProfile.Description: Storage Profile properties of a server

administratorLogin.Description: The administrator's login name of a server. Can only be specified when the server is being created (and is required for creation).

byokEnforcement.Description: Status showing whether the server data encryption is enabled with customer-managed keys.

userVisibleState.Description: A state of a server that is visible to user. Possible values include: 'Ready', 'Dropping', 'Disabled', 'Inaccessible'

fullyQualifiedDomainName.Description: The fully qualified domain name of a server.

earliestRestoreDate.Description: Earliest restore point creation time (ISO8601 format)

replicationRole.Description: The replication role of the server.

masterServerId.Description: The master server id of a replica server.

replicaCapacity.Description: The maximum number of replicas that a master server can have.

privateEndpointConnections.Description: List of private endpoint connections on a server

backupRetentionDays.Description: Backup retention days for the server.

geoRedundantBackup.Description: Enable Geo-redundant or not for server backup. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

storageMB.Description: Max storage allowed for a server.

storageAutogrow.Description: Enable Storage Auto Grow. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

id.Description: Resource ID of the Private Endpoint Connection.

properties.Description: Properties of a private endpoint connection.

provisioningState.Description: State of the private endpoint connection. Possible values include: 'Approving', 'Ready', 'Dropping', 'Failed', 'Rejecting'

id.Description: Resource id of the private endpoint.

status.Description: The private link service connection status. Possible values include: 'Approved', 'Pending', 'Rejected', 'Disconnected'

description.Description: The private link service connection description.

actionsRequired.Description: The actions required for private link service connection. Possible values include: 'None'

administratorLogin.Description: The administrator's login name of a server. Can only be specified when the server is being created (and is required for creation).

administratorLoginPassword.Description: The password of the administrator login.

createMode.Description: The properties used to create a new server.

sourceServerId.Description: The source server id to restore from.

restorePointInTime.Description: Restore point creation time (ISO8601 format), specifying the time to restore from.

createMode.Description: The properties used to create a new server by restoring from a backup.

sourceServerId.Description: The source server id to restore from.

createMode.Description: The properties used to create a new server by restoring to a different region from a geo replicated backup.

sourceServerId.Description: The master server id to create replica from.

createMode.Description: The properties to create a new replica.

properties.Description: The properties of a server firewall rule.

startIpAddress.Description: The start IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

endIpAddress.Description: The end IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

properties.Description: Properties of a virtual network rule.

virtualNetworkSubnetId.Description: The ARM resource id of the virtual network subnet.

ignoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint.Description: Create firewall rule before the virtual network has vnet service endpoint enabled.

state.Description: Virtual Network Rule State. Possible values include: 'Initializing', 'InProgress', 'Ready', 'Deleting', 'Unknown'

properties.Description: The properties of an server Administrator.

login.Description: The server administrator login account name.

tenantId.Description: The server Active Directory Administrator tenant id.

properties.Description: Properties of a security alert policy.

state.Description: Specifies the state of the policy, whether it is enabled or disabled. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

disabledAlerts.Description: Specifies an array of alerts that are disabled. Allowed values are: Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly

emailAddresses.Description: Specifies an array of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

emailAccountAdmins.Description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators.

storageEndpoint.Description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.

storageAccountAccessKey.Description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

retentionDays.Description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.
